data.enText: to leave a mark that is difficult to remove on sth; to be marked in this way
I hope it doesn't stain the carpet.
This carpet stains easily.

data.chText: 浆果汁把他们的手指染成了红色。
data.enText: The juice from the berries stained their fingers red.
to change the colour of sth using a coloured liquid
to stain wood

data.chText: 先把标本染色，再放到显微镜下观察。
data.enText: Stain the specimen before looking at it under the microscope.

data.chText: 他们把地板涂成了深棕色。
data.enText: They stained the floors dark brown.
to damage the opinion that people have of sth

data.chText: 这些事件使该市背上了不应有的恶名。
data.enText: The events had stained the city's reputation unfairly.
a dirty mark on sth, that is difficult to remove
a blood/a coffee/an ink, etc. stain
stubborn stains (= that are very difficult to remove)

data.chText: 我怎么才能把这点污渍除去？
data.enText: How can I get this stain out?

data.chText: 这地毯已经过处理，不易挂污。
data.enText: The carpet has been treated so that it is stain-resistant (= it does not stain easily) .
a liquid used for changing the colour of wood or cloth
something that damages a person's reputation, so that people think badly of them

data.text: mark ♦ stain ♦ streak ♦ speck ♦ blot ♦ smear ♦ spot

data.chText: 以上各词均指污点、斑点、污迹。
data.enText: These are all words for a small area of dirt or another substance on a surface.
mark
a small area of dirt or other substance on the surface of sth, especially one that spoils its appearance

data.chText: 孩子们把厨房的地板弄得污迹斑斑。
data.enText: The kids left dirty marks all over the kitchen floor.
stain
a dirty mark on sth that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid
blood stains
streak
a long thin mark or line that is a different colour from the surface it is on
She had streaks of grey in her hair.
speck
a very small mark, spot or piece of a substance on sth
There isn't a speck of dust anywhere in the house.
blot
a spot or dirty mark left on sth by a substance such as ink or paint being dropped on a surface
smear
a mark made by sth such as oil or paint being spread or rubbed on a surface
spot
a small dirty mark on sth
There were grease spots all over the walls.
a streak/speck/blot/smear/spot of sth
a dirty mark/stain/streak/speck/smear/spot
an ink mark/stain/blot/spot
a(n) oil/grease/paint mark/stain/spot
to leave a mark/stain/streak/speck/blot/smear/spot
to get a mark/stain/spot out of sth

tr: an act that brings discredit to the person who does it
example: he made a huge blot on his copybook
the wine left a dark stain

tr: a symbol of disgrace or infamy
example: And the Lord set a mark upon Cain"--Genesi

tr: the state of being covered with unclean things
(microscopy) a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible

example: The laboratory worker dyed the specimen

tr: color with a liquid dye or tint
example: Stain this table a beautiful walnut color
people knew how to stain glass a beautiful blue in the middle ages
Red wine stains the table cloth

tr: make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air
example: The silver was tarnished by the long exposure to the air
Her reputation was sullied after the affair with a married man

value.def: A stain is a mark on something that is difficult to remove.

example.ex: Remove stains by soaking in a mild solution of bleach.
example.tran: 用温和的漂白剂浸泡以去除污迹。

value.def: If a liquid stains something, the thing becomes coloured or marked by the liquid.

example.ex: Some foods can stain the teeth, as of course can smoking.
example.tran: 某些食物会在牙齿上留下污渍，吸烟当然也会。

value.tran: 在…上留下污迹;玷污;染污

example.ex: His clothing was stained with mud.
